articles.title: Quang Nguyen
articles.contents:
Biography



I am a third-year PhD student in the Department of Statistics & Data Science at Carnegie Mellon University.
I completed my Master of Science degree in Applied Statistics at Loyola University Chicago in December 2021. More previously, I graduated from Wittenberg University in Springfield, Ohio with a BS in Mathematics and Data Science in May 2020. I am originally from Nha Trang, Khanh Hoa, which is located in the South Central Coast of Vietnam (hence this is what qntkhvn represents). In my free time, you may find me watching sports, listening to podcasts, and cooking. I am a huge supporter of Manchester United F.C. of the English Premier League.
My full name in Vietnamese: Nguyễn Ngọc Minh Quang
Education
  
PhD in Statistics and Data Science, in progress

            Quang Nguyen
          
          
            
              
              Welcome to The Q! I am a third-year PhD student in the
              Department of Statistics & Data Science at Carnegie
              Mellon University. Previously, I completed my MS in
              Applied Statistics at Loyola University Chicago and BS in
              Mathematics and Data Science at Wittenberg University.
              I am broadly interested in statistical modeling in
              complex and high-dimensional settings. During my PhD, I
              have worked on problems in areas such as tracking data in
              sports and social networks.
              I am a member of the Carnegie Mellon
              Sports Analytics Center and an organizer of the CMSAC Research
              Lab.
